title: SHIP Dual-Eligible: Complete Question Sequence
description: Complete SHIP mystery-shopper study script for Dual-Eligible scenario (eAppendix 2). Contains all questions in sequence as scripted in the original study. Tests comprehensive knowledge of D-SNP plans, Medicaid integration, cost-sharing assistance, and dual-eligible enrollment options.
source: Dugan K et al. JAMA Network Open. 2025;8(4):e252834 - eAppendix 2 (Dual-Eligible Scenario Script)

persona.current_coverage: Medicare Parts A and B, full Medicaid (Medi-Cal in California)
persona.situation: Dual-eligible beneficiary (Medicare + Medicaid). Has been on Medicare for one year. Currently uses Original Medicare with Medicaid covering cost-sharing. Interested in exploring D-SNP options. Takes medications for chronic conditions. Limited income qualifies for full Medicaid benefits including cost-sharing assistance.

opening_statement: I am on Medicare and also have full Medicaid coverage. I would like help understanding my coverage options. Can you help?

scripted_turns.user_message: When can I select my Medicare coverage plan, and when can I change it later?
scripted_turns.topic: Timing for Initial Medicare Enrollment & Subsequent Changes
scripted_turns.note: Same question as Medicare-Only Q1, but for dual-eligible context
expected_topics: Can select Medicare coverage within 3 months of turning 65
Open Enrollment Period (10/15-12/7)
Annual Election Period (1/1-3/31)
Special Enrollment Period
Dual-eligible beneficiaries may have additional SEP opportunities

scripted_turns.user_message: What are my options for enrolling in Medicare coverage with full Medicaid?
scripted_turns.topic: Medicare Enrollment Options for Dual-Eligible Beneficiaries
expected_topics: Can enroll in Original Medicare with Medicaid as secondary
Can enroll in a D-SNP (Dual Special Needs Plan)
Medicaid will help cover Medicare costs
Must have Medicare Part A and Part B to enroll in D-SNP
D-SNPs provide integrated care coordination

scripted_turns.user_message: What should I consider when deciding whether to enroll in a D-SNP?
scripted_turns.note: Most difficult question in SHIP study (1% accurate-complete baseline)
expected_topics: D-SNPs integrate Medicare and Medicaid benefits
Must use plan's network of providers
May need to change doctors if current PCP not in network
D-SNPs coordinate medical, pharmacy, and long-term care
May offer additional benefits beyond Original Medicare
Medicaid continues to cover cost-sharing
Can only enroll if eligible for both Medicare and Medicaid

scripted_turns.user_message: Are there any D-SNPs available where I live?
expected_topics: Need to check Medicare.gov Plan Finder for local availability
D-SNP availability varies by county
Plans available in California/Los Angeles County
Direction to resources for finding plans

scripted_turns.user_message: Do either regular Medicare, Medicare Advantage Plans, D-SNPs, or Medicaid cover long-term care?
expected_topics: Medicare and Medicare Advantage generally do not cover long-term care
Some time-limited nursing facility stays may be covered
Medicaid may cover long-term care for eligible beneficiaries
D-SNPs may help coordinate long-term care services through Medicaid
State-specific Medicaid rules apply

scripted_turns.user_message: Will Medicaid cover my Medicare premiums and cost-sharing?
expected_topics: Full Medicaid (QMB Plus) covers Medicare Part B premium
Medicaid covers Medicare deductibles, copays, and coinsurance
Level of assistance depends on Medicaid eligibility category
QMB (Qualified Medicare Beneficiary) program specifics
SLMB (Specified Low-Income Medicare Beneficiary) program

scripted_turns.user_message: Are there programs that can help me pay for Medicare costs if I don't qualify for full Medicaid?
expected_topics: Medicare Savings Programs (QMB, SLMB, QI)
Extra Help/Low-Income Subsidy for Part D
State Pharmaceutical Assistance Programs
Income and asset limits for each program
How to apply for assistance

scripted_turns.user_message: I have a friend who does not speak much English. Do you offer Spanish translation services at your location?
expected_topics: Availability of Spanish translation services
Days/times when services are available
Other language services available

variation_knobs.note: Questions should be asked in the exact order listed, exactly as worded in the script. Do not skip any questions.

instructions.primary_objective: Ask every question listed. Do not skip any questions.
instructions.if_counselor_doesnt_know: Move on to the next question until all questions have been asked.
instructions.questioning_approach: Ask questions in the order listed, exactly as written.
instructions.persona_consistency: Answer questions based on the Scenario Details. Do not embellish your scenario or give any information that is not requested.

notes: This scenario contains the complete question sequence from the SHIP dual-eligible mystery-shopper study.
Q3 (D-SNP considerations) had only 1% accurate-complete responses in the SHIP study - the most difficult question.
The answer_key and scoring_rubric should be developed separately based on eAppendix 4 of the SHIP study.
This file is designed to be executed as a sequential conversation with a target AI model.
Each question tests different aspects of dual-eligible Medicare and Medicaid knowledge.

temporal_validity.notes: Based on SHIP mystery-shopper study (Dugan et al. 2025). D-SNP availability, Medicaid rules, and MSP income limits are year-dependent and state-specific.
